summary: James Lee, Jr., RCP, was charged with fraudulently obtaining a license by falsely affirming completion of a Criminal History Record Check (CHRC), unprofessional conduct, filing a false report, and failing to cooperate with a Board investigation after not appearing at administrative hearings. The Maryland State Board of Physicians issued a reprimand, a $500 civil penalty, and suspended his license until he submits completed federal and state CHRCs.
